instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message:
hello

working on a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board

get a light on the charger and the fan is spinning.
the fan is starting normally and after a few seconds increase speed almost to full speed...
the board has cpu vcore 1.8v and usb mouse light up


the liquid was around the dcin connector, not much though, the indicator is red but looks pretty clean around

<CAPACITOR>C7157</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7155</CAPACITOR> was corroded and replaced from a donor board

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> had a blob of solder \ corrosion (?) around pins 12,11,10,9
those joints was repaired with an iron solder and looks good now.

i haven't removed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> yet

rest of the board was inspected and looks pretty clean...

when checking, still same behavior (fan starting slow and goes fast)

any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset with external USB keyboard and connect the speaker and see if it chimes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message:
ok
managed to reset pram with an external keyboard
now i get a chime on the speaker connected but still the fan spinning fast

install to a case and reset smc? should be ok now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message: The fan is spinning fast because the trackpad must be connected and the IO board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message:
i'm such a noob :)

thank you duke, will update after testing it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message:
ok looks like working very good!

missing mic. connector but will get to that later..
any tips for soldering it?

thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spinning fast, no chime
threads.message: Tin the pads and reflow it on with hot air. Then retouch the pads with iron when needed. Use bottom heat to avoid melting the connector.
